javadoc: A container class to hold ELF relocations.

methods.name: createElfRelocationTable

params.name: relocTableSection
params.comment: relocation table section header or null if associated with a dynamic table entry

params.name: addrOffset
params.comment: memory address of relocation table (should already be adjusted for prelink)

params.name: length
params.comment: length of relocation table in bytes

params.name: entrySize
params.comment: size of each relocation entry in bytes

params.name: addendTypeReloc
params.comment: true if addend type relocation table

params.name: sectionToBeRelocated
params.comment: or null for dynamic relocation table

methods.javadoc: DO NOT USE THIS CONSTRUCTOR, USE create*(GenericFactory ...) FACTORY METHODS INSTEAD.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: DO NOT USE THIS CONSTRUCTOR, USE create*(GenericFactory ...) FACTORY METHODS INSTEAD.

methods.javadoc:
@return true if has addend relocations, otherwise addend extraction from
 relocation target may be required
methods.name: hasAddendRelocations

return.comment:
true if has addend relocations, otherwise addend extraction from
 relocation target may be required

methods.javadoc:
Returns the section where the relocations will be applied.
 For example, this method will return ".plt" for ".rel.plt"
@return the section where the relocations will be applied
 or null for dynamic relocation table not associated with 
 a section.
methods.name: getSectionToBeRelocated
methods.comment:
Returns the section where the relocations will be applied.
 For example, this method will return ".plt" for ".rel.plt"

return.comment:
the section where the relocations will be applied
 or null for dynamic relocation table not associated with 
 a section.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the relocations defined in this table.
@return the relocations defined in this table
methods.name: getRelocations
methods.comment: Returns the relocations defined in this table.

return.comment: the relocations defined in this table

methods.javadoc:
Returns the associated symbol table.
 A relocation object contains a symbol index.
 This index is into this symbol table.
@return the associated symbol table
methods.name: getAssociatedSymbolTable
methods.comment:
Returns the associated symbol table.
 A relocation object contains a symbol index.
 This index is into this symbol table.

methods.name: getTableSectionHeader
methods.comment:
Get section header which corresponds to this table, or null
 if only associated with a dynamic table entry

return.comment: relocation table section header or null

name: ElfRelocationTable
comment: A container class to hold ELF relocations.
